MainCategory.Description: Technical Proficiency: Demonstrates mastery of required programming languages and tools necessary for software development.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate the candidate's resume and portfolio for projects showcasing proficiency in C#, C++, Objective-C, or JavaScript. Assess their ability to discuss the strengths and weaknesses of each language and their suitability for different tasks. During the interview, ask technical questions related to data structures, algorithms, and design patterns, tailored to the specific languages listed. Review past projects for code quality and adherence to best practices.
MainCategory.Justification: Essential for implementing features and debugging code, as specified in the Main JD. This is directly mentioned in the requirements section of the main JD.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited or no demonstrable proficiency in required languages or tools. Struggles to explain basic concepts.
Some proficiency in one or two required languages, but lacks depth of knowledge or experience. Can explain basic concepts, but struggles with complex problems.
Demonstrates strong proficiency in multiple required languages and tools. Can effectively apply them to solve complex problems. Shows good understanding of underlying principles.

Exceptional proficiency in all required languages and tools. Demonstrates expert-level knowledge and can apply them creatively to solve novel problems. Actively contributes to the wider community (e.g., open source).

MainCategory.Description: Problem-Solving and Debugging Skills: Possesses excellent abilities to identify, analyze, and resolve software defects and technical challenges.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Present the candidate with coding challenges or debugging scenarios during the interview. Observe their approach, analytical skills, and ability to trace errors. Review their past project experience for examples of problem-solving and debugging complex issues. Ask about their preferred debugging tools and techniques.
MainCategory.Justification: Critical for maintaining software quality and efficiently resolving issues, directly aligned with 'Excellent debugging and problem-solving skills' from the Main JD and highlighted as important in the Additional JD for ensuring application reliability.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to identify and analyze basic software defects. Unable to effectively use debugging tools.
Can identify and analyze some software defects, but requires assistance with complex issues. Limited experience with debugging tools.
Demonstrates strong problem-solving and debugging skills. Can effectively identify, analyze, and resolve most software defects independently. Proficient in using debugging tools.
Exceptional problem-solving and debugging skills. Can quickly identify, analyze, and resolve even the most complex software defects. A master of debugging tools and techniques.

MainCategory.Description: Collaboration and Communication: Effectively works with other programmers, technical directors, and stakeholders to design, implement, and document features.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's ability to explain technical concepts clearly and concisely. Ask behavioral questions about their experience working in teams, resolving conflicts, and sharing ideas. Evaluate their written communication skills based on their resume, cover letter, and any submitted documentation.
MainCategory.Justification: Essential for coordinating tasks, designing features, and contributing to technical documentation, aligning with 'Collaborate with other programmers' and 'Contribute to technical design documentation' from the Main JD. Teamwork and communication are also emphasized in the Additional JD.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to communicate technical concepts effectively. Difficulty working in team environments.
Can communicate technical concepts with some clarity, but struggles to tailor communication to different audiences. Some experience working in teams.
Communicates technical concepts clearly and concisely to diverse audiences. Works effectively in team environments and proactively shares information.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills. Able to build strong relationships with colleagues and stakeholders. A highly effective team player and mentor.

MainCategory.Description: Code Quality and Documentation: Consistently produces well-organized, optimized, and documented source code that adheres to coding standards.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Review the candidate's code samples for clarity, efficiency, and adherence to coding standards. Assess their ability to document code effectively. Ask about their experience with code review processes and version control systems.
MainCategory.Justification: Directly addresses the requirement to 'Quickly produce well-organized, optimized, and documented source code' from the Main JD. Code quality is also mentioned in the additional JD's interview questions regarding quality assurance.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Code is poorly organized, inefficient, and lacks documentation. Fails to adhere to basic coding standards.
Code is somewhat organized and documented, but could be improved. Adheres to some coding standards.
Code is well-organized, efficient, and well-documented. Adheres to coding standards and best practices.
Code is exceptionally well-organized, optimized, and documented. A role model for other developers.

MainCategory.Description: Adaptability and Learning: Demonstrates a willingness to continuously learn and improve skills, adapt to new technologies and projects.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Explore the candidate's history of learning new technologies and their interest in staying up-to-date with industry trends. Ask about specific instances where they quickly learned a new skill or technology to solve a problem. Assess their understanding of different development methodologies and their willingness to adapt their approach based on project requirements. The candidate must have a desire to continue professional growth through training and education
MainCategory.Justification: Aligned with the 'Continuously learn and improve skills' requirement from the Main JD and ties into the additional JD's emphasis on continuous learning and the ability to adapt to a rapidly evolving environment.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Shows little interest in learning new technologies or adapting to changing project requirements. Resistant to new ideas.
Willing to learn new technologies, but requires significant guidance and support. Adapts to new project requirements with some difficulty.
Demonstrates a proactive approach to learning new technologies and adapting to changing project requirements. Seeks out opportunities for professional development.
An enthusiastic learner who is always seeking new challenges and opportunities for growth. Adapts quickly and effectively to new technologies and project requirements. A valuable asset to any team.

SubCategory.Description: Attention to Detail: Pays close attention to detail and ensures that all tasks are carried out to the highest standard.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's responses to questions requiring specific examples of their attention to detail. Review their past projects and code samples for errors or inconsistencies. During the interview, present them with a detailed task and observe their approach.
SubCategory.Justification: Directly linked to 'Attention to detail is essential' from the Main JD.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Frequently overlooks important details. Makes careless errors.
Pays attention to detail in some cases, but occasionally misses important information.
Consistently pays attention to detail and ensures that tasks are carried out to the highest standard.

SubCategory.Description: Independence: Ability to work independently when required, demonstrating self-direction and initiative.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Ask behavioral questions about the candidate's experience working independently and managing their time effectively. Assess their ability to prioritize tasks and solve problems without constant supervision.
SubCategory.Justification: Addresses the 'Work independently when required' requirement from the Main JD.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Requires constant supervision and struggles to work independently.
Can work independently on some tasks, but requires guidance on complex projects.
Works independently and effectively manages time and resources. Demonstrates initiative and self-direction.

SubCategory.Description: Unity/Unreal Engine Experience: Possesses experience with Unity or Unreal game engines (beneficial).
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's resume and portfolio for projects showcasing Unity or Unreal engine experience. Ask technical questions related to game development concepts and the specific features of each engine.
SubCategory.Justification: Addresses the 'Unity or Unreal game engine experience' from the Beneficial Skills section of the Main JD.

ScoringGuided.Comment: No experience with Unity or Unreal Engine.
Some basic experience with Unity or Unreal Engine.
Demonstrates strong proficiency with Unity or Unreal Engine. Has experience developing and shipping games or interactive experiences.

SubCategory.Description: Web Development Skills: Possesses web development skills, including proficiency with HTML/CSS and JavaScript (beneficial).
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's resume and portfolio for projects showcasing web development skills. Ask technical questions related to front-end and back-end web development concepts.
SubCategory.Justification: Addresses the 'Web development skills (HTML/CSS, JavaScript)' from the Beneficial Skills section of the Main JD.

ScoringGuided.Comment: No experience with web development technologies.
Some basic experience with HTML/CSS and JavaScript.
Demonstrates strong proficiency with HTML/CSS, JavaScript, and other web development technologies. Has experience developing and deploying web applications.

SubCategory.Description: Quality Assurance Knowledge: Familiarity with quality assurance processes for writing code and identifying bugs.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: During the interview, ask about the candidate's approach to writing quality code and how they spot bugs in an application. Look for references to test-driven development (TDD) techniques and debugging tools. Additionally, inquire about their understanding of code review processes.
SubCategory.Justification: Emphasized in the Additional JD's interview questions and directly relates to the ability to deliver reliable software.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Little to no understanding of quality assurance processes or debugging techniques.
Basic understanding of quality assurance processes, but limited practical experience.
Demonstrates a solid understanding of quality assurance processes and actively uses debugging tools and techniques.
